x-redlock-auth.description: The x-redlock-auth value is a JSON Web Token (JWT).
x-redlock-auth.name: x-redlock-auth

DecoratedResourceInfo.description: Model for resource info and status list

DecoratedResourceInfoResult.description: Model for resource info and status list

allOf.description: Use as page token to return next page of data

resources.description: List of metadata for resources that match filter

totalMatchedCount.description: Total number of filtered resources, both scanned and unscanned

fields.description: Array of specific fields to return

groupBy.description: For asset or data inventory only. Group returned items by **cloud.type**, **cloud.service**, **cloud.region**, **cloud.account**, and/or **resource.type**

limit.description: Maximum number of items to return. When data is paginated, maximum number of items per page

offset.description: The number of items to skip before selecting items to return. Default is zero

pageToken.description: Setting this pagination Token to the **nextPageToken** from a response object returns the next page of data

sortBy.description: Array of sort properties. Append **:asc** or  **:desc** to the key to sort by ascending or descending order respectively. Example sort properties are **id:asc** and **timestamp:desc**

options.description: Filter options, which lists all the default options for static filters or all the recent options, if any, for non-static filters

query.description: Case-insensitive fuzzy search autocomplete filter. Includes only items that contain the query as a substring.

relativeTimeType.description: Direction in which to count time. Default = BACKWARD

data.description: Raw JSON data for the resource

TimeRangeConfigModel.description: See the [Time Range Model](/api/cloud/api-time-range-model) for details.

info.description:
The resource explorer is also known as the asset explorer.

### Where Do I Find the RRN For My Resource?

You can find the RRN for a resource in the URL when you view that resource in the Prisma Cloud asset explorer.
The following is an example of such a URL. The RRN is in the URL query string.

```
https://app.prismacloud.io/investigate/details?resourceId=rrn:aws:storageBucket:us-east-1:123456789012:test-bucket 
``` 

### Account Representation

If the **regionId** and **resourceId** are not in the RRN, then the **cloudType** and **resourceType** fields
in thr RRN are optional. In this siutation, the RRN identifies an account.


Full RRN:
```
rrn:::us-west-1:12345678901:i-ABCDEFGH
```

Abridged RRN:
```  
rrn::::12345678901
```
info.title: Prisma Cloud Resource Explorer (Asset Explorer) API Overview

post.description:
Returns detailed information for the resource with the given **rrn**.  

Generally, the data field in the response object contains the raw JSON blob as is received from the 
source cloud service provider API for the given resource.

Only the **rrn** parameter in the request body is used for this API. Ignore the **timelineItemId** and 
**findingType** fields for this API.

An example request body is:
```
{
  "rrn": "rrn::storageBucket:us-east-1:123456789012:test-bucket"
}
```

x-codeSamples.source:
import requests

url = "https://api.prismacloud.io/resource"

payload = {
    "findingType": ["string"],
    "riskFactors": ["CRITICAL_SEVERITY"],
    "rrn": "string",
    "timelineItemId": "string"
}
headers = {
    "content-type": "application/json; charset=UTF-8",
    "x-redlock-auth": "REPLACE_KEY_VALUE"
}

response = requests.request("POST", url, json=payload, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

curl --request POST \
  --url https://api.prismacloud.io/resource \
  --header 'content-type: application/json; charset=UTF-8' \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE' \
  --data '{"findingType":["string"],"riskFactors":["CRITICAL_SEVERITY"],"rrn":"string","timelineItemId":"string"}'

get.description: Get a list of all host findings for a specific alert.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://api.prismacloud.io/resource/external_finding?alertId=SOME_STRING_VALUE&type=SOME_ARRAY_VALUE&source=SOME_ARRAY_VALUE' \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'

post.description:
Returns a list of all host findings for the current resource.  

Supported finding types:

Finding Type | Key
-----------| ----
AWS GuardDuty Host | **guard_duty_host**
AWS GuardDuty IAM  | **guard_duty_iam**
AWS Inspector Security Best Practices | **inspector_sbp**
AWS Runtime Behavior Analysis | **inspector_rba_count**
CIS Compliance | **compliance_cis**
Host Vulnerability | **host_vulnerability_cve**

Only the **rrn** parameter in the request body is used for this API. Ignore the **timelineItemId** 
field for this API.

An example request body with a specified finding type is:
```json
{
  "findingType": [ "host_vulnerability_cve", "inspector_sbp" ],
  "rrn": "rrn::instance:us-east-1:i-xxxxxxxxxx"
}
``` 

An example request body for all finding types is:
```json
{
  "rrn": "rrn::instance:us-east-1:i-xxxxxxxxxx"
}

x-codeSamples.source:
import requests

url = "https://api.prismacloud.io/resource/external_finding"

payload = {

}

    "x-redlock-auth": "REPLACE_KEY_VALUE"
}

response = requests.request("POST", url, json=payload, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

curl --request POST \
  --url https://api.prismacloud.io/resource/external_finding \
  --header 'content-type: application/json; charset=UTF-8' \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE' \
  --data '{"findingType":["string"],"riskFactors":["CRITICAL_SEVERITY"],"rrn":"string","timelineItemId":"string"}'

post.description:
Returns the raw metadata of the configuration of a resource at a given point in time.  

Generally, the response object contains the raw JSON blob as is received from the 
source cloud service provider API.

Only the **rrn** parameter in the request body is used for this API. Ignore the **findingType** 
field for this API.

You can find the **timelineItemId** for your resource from the timeline results that 
[Get Resource Timeline](/api/cloud/cspm/resource-explorer#operation/get-timeline-for-resource)
returns.

An example request body is:
```json
{
  "rrn": "rrn::instance:us-east-1:i-xxxxxxxxxx",
  "timelineItemId": "xxxxxxxxxxxxxx"
}
```

x-codeSamples.source:

}

get.description:
Returns a full breakdown of passed/failed statistics and associated policies for resources.  

The query parameters enable you to add filters to your request to narrow your results.
### Filter by Time
The following table has examples of common filters by time. The time filter narrows the
response to resources from account onboarding until the point in time of interest.

Point in time of interest | timeAmount | timeType | timeUnit 
-------------| ---- | ----------- | -------------
24 hours ago | 24 | **relative** | hour      
1 week ago |  1 | **relative** | week
1 month ago | 1 | **relative** | month        
1 year ago | 1 | **relative** | year                
Latest | Not required with **to_now** | **to_now** | Defaults to **epoch**

### How Current is the Returned Data?
Since Prisma Cloud relies on snapshots of data, there can be an hour or two delay between the 
time a resource passes or fails a policy check and the reporting of that result through this method.

### Filter by Cloud Type
You can specify more than one cloud type to request a combination of data. For 
example **cloud.type=gcp&cloud.type=azure** returns data for both **gcp** and **azure**.

### Filter by Compliance Standard, Requirement, and/or Section 
You can also broaden your filter by specifying any of the following query parameters more than once:
* **policy.complianceStandard**
* **policy.complianceRequirement**
* **policy.complianceSection**

parameters.description: Time Amount. Required for **timeType** **relative**. Unused for **timeType** **to_now**
parameters.name: timeAmount

parameters.description: Time Unit. Required for **timeType** **relative**. Unused for **timeType** **to_now**
parameters.name: timeUnit

parameters.description: Policy compliance standard. You can specify policy.complianceStandard=* to return the data for all compliance standards.
parameters.name: policy.complianceStandard

parameters.description: Maximum number of entries to be returned. A single API call retrieves a maximum of 10,000 resources, which is also the default.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Whether or not the resources were scanned and whether they passed or failed the scan. The default is **all**.
parameters.name: scan.status

parameters.description: Token identifying the required page of data. When there are multiple pages of data, the **nextPageToken** from the response can be used in this parameter
parameters.name: pageToken

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://api.prismacloud.io/resource/scan_info?timeType=SOME_STRING_VALUE&timeAmount=SOME_STRING_VALUE&timeUnit=SOME_STRING_VALUE&cloud.account=SOME_STRING_VALUE&cloud.type=SOME_STRING_VALUE&cloud.region=SOME_STRING_VALUE&account.group=SOME_STRING_VALUE&policy.complianceStandard=SOME_STRING_VALUE&policy.complianceRequirement=SOME_STRING_VALUE&policy.complianceSection=SOME_STRING_VALUE&limit=SOME_STRING_VALUE&scan.status=SOME_STRING_VALUE&pageToken=SOME_STRING_VALUE' \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'

post.description:
Returns a full breakdown of passed/failed statistics and associated policies for resources.  

You can get a list of the valid names and values for the filters body parameter through 
[List Inventory Filters V2](/api/cloud/cspm/asset-inventory#operation/get-asset-inventory-v2-filters-and-options)
 and 
 [List Inventory Dashboard Filter Autocomplete Suggestions V2](/api/cloud/cspm/asset-inventory#operation/get-asset-inventory-v2-dashboard-filter-options).

### Filter by Time
The time filter narrows the response to resources from account onboarding until the point in time of interest.

#### Time Types

Time Type | Required **timeRange.value** Parameters
----------|-----------------
**to_now** | No **timeRange.value** parameter required
**relative** | **timeRange.value.amount**, **timeRange.value.unit** 
**absolute** | **timeRange.value.endTime** (**timeRange.value.startTime** is ignored)

### How Current is the Returned Data?
Since Prisma Cloud relies on snapshots of data, there can be an hour or two delay between the 
time a resource passes or fails a policy check and the reporting of that result through this method.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request POST \
  --url https://api.prismacloud.io/resource/scan_info \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE' \
  --data '{"detailed":true,"fields":["string"],"filters":[{"name":"string","operator":"=","value":"string"}],"groupBy":["string"],"limit":0,"offset":0,"pageToken":"string","sortBy":["string"],"timeRange":{"relativeTimeType":"BACKWARD","type":"relative","value":{"amount":0,"unit":"minute"}}}'
